column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3. Results and Discussion
#Text=Similar results are found for each three subsets generated by full random sampling and , hence , we only show results for the first subset .
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=shows feature importance scores of considered predictors given by RF for commonly used sensor VIs ( results for MODIS-PRI and OLI-TCTG are shown later ) .
#Text=It is shown that for most cases , MODIS-derived VIs show similar sensitivities to those of VIs derived from OLI , while VIs derived from the Sentinel family exhibit consistent sensitivities .
#Text=This is because compared to MODIS and OLI , MSI and OLCI are narrow-band sensors and have relatively similar band settings .
#Text=For almost all VIs , LAI is the most influential predictor .
#Text=LAI is one of the key parameters describing canopy structure .
#Text=In general , LAI determines the chance that incident solar photons interact with a leaf .
#Text=For photosynthetically active radiation ( PAR ) bands and water absorption bands , a large LAI can induce strong canopy absorption of radiation and result in very low canopy ρ .
#Text=For weak absorption bands , such as NIR , solar photons are strongly scattered by the leaves in a dense canopy with a large LAI , which can result in significant anisotropic canopy ρ .
#Text=Therefore , LAI has a large influence on canopy ρ at all bands , especially for longer wavelengths .
#Text=Accordingly , all the VIs are sensitive to LAI .
#Text=The special case is EVI derived from MODIS and OLI , which is more sensitive to CCC ( MTCI will be discussed later ) .
#Text=Because CCC is the product of total LAI and Cab , EVI is considered to be more sensitive to green LAI .

#Text=Based on the fact that photosynthesis is mainly driven by chlorophyll , EVI might be more representative for photosynthesis-related greenness than other VIs ( especially NDVI ) due to its stronger sensitivity to CCC .

#Text=The usefulness of MODIS- and Landsat-derived EVI ( and two-band EVI , EVI2 ) in gross primary production ( GPP ) estimation has been demonstrated by several studies at both ecosystem and global scales .
#Text=The strong sensitivity of EVI to CCC shown in
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=can be a reason for the good performance of EVI in indicating photosynthetic capacity .
#Text=However , it is noted that LAI is still the dominating parameter for EVI derived from MSI and OLCI .
#Text=Compared to OLI and MODIS , the main difference is that these two sensors are designed with narrow red and NIR channels .

#Text=Because chlorophyll does not directly affect NIR reflectance , the potentially stronger sensitivity of broad red band canopy ρ to CCC is supposed to be the reason for the observed stronger sensitivity of broad-band EVI to CCC .

#Text=Different GSA results for EVI from broad- and narrow-band sensors indicate that band settings ( central wavelength and full width at half maximum , FWHM ) may change the sensitivity of a VI and should be considered for applications with multi-sensor analysis and future spaceborne sensor design .
#Text=For all four sensors , the sensitivity of NDVI is dominated by LAI , and far behind is CCC as the second influential factor .
#Text=Generally , LAI can be retrieved from canopy ρ at red and NIR bands on the basis of the RT theory .
#Text=Therefore , a direct relationship can be established between NDVI and LAI , although NDVI can saturate when LAI is high .
#Text=In this sense , NDVI , which is probably the most ever-used VI , mainly represents variations of LAI across time and space .
#Text=In addition , compared to EVI , NDVI exhibits a relatively stronger soil sensitivity .
#Text=This is because a soil adjustment parameter ( L ) is introduced into EVI , which makes EVI more resistant against canopy background changes .
#Text=Yet , constant L also gives EVI additional sensitivity to NIR band ρ , especially in dense canopy cases where blue and red band ρ are close to zero .
#Text=A similar situation applies for NIRv , whose variation is mainly driven by NIR ρ when NDVI saturates in dense canopy cases .
#Text=For NIR bands , solar photons are strongly scattered by leaves and are weakly absorbed by non-photosynthetic constituents .

#Text=The way that NIR photons are scattered depends on canopy structure ( represented by LAI and leaf inclination angle , LIA , for homogeneous canopies ) and the direction of incident light ( represented by solar zenith angle , SZA ) , while absorption is dominated by brown elements ( represented by brown pigment content , Cbrown and dry matter content , Cdm ) .
#Text=Therefore , the strong sensitivity of EVI and NIRv to NIR band ρ makes them exhibit relatively strong sensitivities to LAI , LIA , Cdm , and SZA .

#Text=The sensitivity of EVI and NIRv to canopy structure and non-photosynthetically related parameters should be considered when applied at large scales across different ecosystems with different canopy architectures .
